topic: Trustworthiness Benchmarks for AI Models

  entities:
    HEIM|Benchmark
    HRS-Bench|Benchmark
    Stable Bias|Benchmark
    DALL-EVAL|Benchmark
    GenEVAL|Benchmark
    MultiTrust|Benchmark
    MLLM-Guard|Benchmark
    MM-SafetyBench|Benchmark
    UniCorn|Benchmark
    BenchLMM|Benchmark
    Halle-switch|Benchmark
    Red-Teaming VLM|Benchmark
    JailBreak-V|Benchmark
    GOAT-Bench|Benchmark
    Ch3Ef|Benchmark
    GenderBias|Benchmark
    TrustGen|Benchmark
    Text-to-image models|Technology
    Vision-language models|Technology
    Large language models|Technology

  proposition: Text-to-image models and vision-language models have multiple trustworthiness evaluation benchmarks.
    entity-entity relationships:
    Text-to-image models|EVALUATED_BY|HEIM
    Text-to-image models|EVALUATED_BY|HRS-Bench
    Text-to-image models|EVALUATED_BY|Stable Bias
    Text-to-image models|EVALUATED_BY|DALL-EVAL
    Text-to-image models|EVALUATED_BY|GenEVAL
    Text-to-image models|EVALUATED_BY|MultiTrust
    Text-to-image models|EVALUATED_BY|MLLM-Guard
    Text-to-image models|EVALUATED_BY|MM-SafetyBench
    Text-to-image models|EVALUATED_BY|UniCorn
    Text-to-image models|EVALUATED_BY|BenchLMM
    Text-to-image models|EVALUATED_BY|Halle-switch
    Text-to-image models|EVALUATED_BY|Red-Teaming VLM
    Text-to-image models|EVALUATED_BY|JailBreak-V
    Text-to-image models|EVALUATED_BY|GOAT-Bench
    Text-to-image models|EVALUATED_BY|Ch3Ef
    Text-to-image models|EVALUATED_BY|GenderBias
    Text-to-image models|EVALUATED_BY|TrustGen

  proposition: HEIM benchmark covers truthfulness, safety, fairness, and robustness dimensions.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    HEIM|EVALUATES|truthfulness
    HEIM|EVALUATES|safety
    HEIM|EVALUATES|fairness
    HEIM|EVALUATES|robustness

  proposition: HRS-Bench focuses specifically on truthfulness assessment.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    HRS-Bench|EVALUATES|truthfulness

  proposition: Stable Bias primarily addresses fairness concerns.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Stable Bias|EVALUATES|fairness

  proposition: DALL-EVAL and GenEVAL emphasize truthfulness evaluation.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    DALL-EVAL|EVALUATES|truthfulness
    GenEVAL|EVALUATES|truthfulness

  proposition: MultiTrust and MLLM-Guard cover multiple trustworthiness dimensions.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    MultiTrust|EVALUATES|multiple trustworthiness dimensions
    MLLM-Guard|EVALUATES|multiple trustworthiness dimensions

  proposition: MM-SafetyBench and UniCorn focus on safety and privacy considerations.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    MM-SafetyBench|EVALUATES|safety
    MM-SafetyBench|EVALUATES|privacy
    UniCorn|EVALUATES|safety
    UniCorn|EVALUATES|privacy

  proposition: BenchLMM and Halle-switch prioritize robustness testing.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    BenchLMM|EVALUATES|robustness
    Halle-switch|EVALUATES|robustness

  proposition: Red-Teaming VLM and JailBreak-V are specialized for security evaluation.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Red-Teaming VLM|EVALUATES|security
    JailBreak-V|EVALUATES|security

  proposition: GOAT-Bench addresses safety and fairness.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    GOAT-Bench|EVALUATES|safety
    GOAT-Bench|EVALUATES|fairness

  proposition: Ch3Ef and GenderBias focus on specific biases and fairness concerns.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Ch3Ef|EVALUATES|biases
    Ch3Ef|EVALUATES|fairness
    GenderBias|EVALUATES|biases
    GenderBias|EVALUATES|fairness

  proposition: TrustGen is the most extensive benchmark covering truthfulness, safety, fairness, robustness, privacy, machine ethics, and advanced AI risk.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    TrustGen|EVALUATES|truthfulness
    TrustGen|EVALUATES|safety
    TrustGen|EVALUATES|fairness
    TrustGen|EVALUATES|robustness
    TrustGen|EVALUATES|privacy
    TrustGen|EVALUATES|machine ethics
    TrustGen|EVALUATES|advanced AI risk

  proposition: TrustGen supports evaluation of multiple generative foundation models including text-to-image models, large language models, and vision-language models.
    entity-entity relationships:
    TrustGen|EVALUATES|Text-to-image models
    TrustGen|EVALUATES|Large language models
    TrustGen|EVALUATES|Vision-language models

topic: Guidelines for Trustworthy Generative Foundation Models

  entities:
    Generative foundation models|Technology
    EU AI Act|Regulation

  proposition: Trustworthiness of generative foundation models is a multidimensional characteristic.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Generative foundation models|CHARACTERIZED_BY|multidimensional trustworthiness

  proposition: Trustworthiness varies in importance depending on application context.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Trustworthiness|VARIES_BY|application context

  proposition: The guidelines aim to provide adaptable principles for diverse stakeholders.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Guidelines|PURPOSE|provide adaptable principles
    Guidelines|TARGETS|diverse stakeholders

  proposition: Guidelines serve as a flexible toolkit for decision-making, design, and evaluation.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Guidelines|FUNCTIONS_AS|flexible toolkit
    Guidelines|SUPPORTS|decision-making
    Guidelines|SUPPORTS|design
    Guidelines|SUPPORTS|evaluation

  proposition: The framework is intended to support developers, regulators, and researchers.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Framework|SUPPORTS|developers
    Framework|SUPPORTS|regulators
    Framework|SUPPORTS|researchers

  proposition: Guidelines differ from existing frameworks like EU AI Act by being application-agnostic and stakeholder-adaptive.
    entity-entity relationships:
    Guidelines|DIFFERS_FROM|EU AI Act

  proposition: The guidelines function as both a "value anchor" and a "value scale" for trustworthy generative foundation models.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Guidelines|FUNCTIONS_AS|value anchor
    Guidelines|FUNCTIONS_AS|value scale
    Guidelines|TARGETS|trustworthy generative foundation models

topic: Key Considerations for Establishing Guidelines

  proposition: Ethics and social responsibility are essential for model behavior.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Model|REQUIRES|ethics
    Model|REQUIRES|social responsibility

  proposition: Guidelines must respect human rights, cultural diversity, and societal values.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Guidelines|MUST_RESPECT|human rights
    Guidelines|MUST_RESPECT|cultural diversity
    Guidelines|MUST_RESPECT|societal values

  proposition: Ethical considerations emphasize fairness and preventing bias.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Ethical considerations|FOCUS_ON|fairness
    Ethical considerations|FOCUS_ON|preventing bias

  proposition: Social responsibility requires models to generate ethical outcomes.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Social responsibility|REQUIRES|ethical outcomes

  proposition: Risk management is crucial for addressing potential threats and model failures.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Risk management|ADDRESSES|potential threats
    Risk management|ADDRESSES|model failures

  proposition: Guidelines must include mechanisms for robust design and vulnerability mitigation.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Guidelines|MUST_INCLUDE|robust design mechanisms
    Guidelines|MUST_INCLUDE|vulnerability mitigation mechanisms

  proposition: Continuous monitoring and stress testing are critical for maintaining model trustworthiness.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Continuous monitoring|MAINTAINS|model trustworthiness
    Stress testing|MAINTAINS|model trustworthiness
